site.title: One Breath Partnership
site.description: One Breath Partnership elevates the work for clean air for everyone in Houston, Harris County and Texas.
site.home_header: Living every day like an ozone action day.

node.title: ‘Make trouble’: A conversation about servant leadership with Harris County Attorney Christian Menefee

children.text: 'Ultimately, I was elected by the people of Harris County, which includes Fifth Ward, and Third Ward, and Sunnyside, and Independence Heights, and the East End. And so I have to do what I have to do for those communities.'

mainImage.alt: Under current state law, the maximum fine TCEQ can levy for violating air permits is just $25,000 per day. Photo: Julie Dermansky.
mainImage.caption: Under current state law, the maximum fine TCEQ can levy for violating air permits is just $25,000 per day. Photo: Julie Dermansky.

node.title: Why doesn't TCEQ fine polluters more?

children.text: In Texas, it can cost less to be caught polluting than to continue to pollute. And industry is banking on that.

node.title: How TCEQ made a cancer-causing chemical seem safer than it is

node.title: Communities can monitor their air. Only good government can improve it.

children.text: Leaders in many Houston communities of color are using new technology to protect their health from harmful air pollution and advocate for progress.

node.title: Port Houston will use less-polluting equipment for Ship Channel expansion

children.text: The diesel-burning dredges and equipment Port Houston had planned to use could have released into already overburdened communities as much toxic air pollution as a new refinery.
